intro: Acrodiclidium oppositifolium, commonly known as the desert holly, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and small, opposite leaves that help reduce water loss. The plant produces yellow flowers in late spring, which are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and drought conditions. Due to its unique appearance and resilience, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry climates.
